channel.title: CSOH - Cloud Security News
channel.description: Latest cloud security news curated by Cloud Security Office Hours. Covers AWS, Azure, GCP, Kubernetes vulnerabilities, breaches, and more.

item.title: In Other News: Ransomware Shuts US Clinics, ICS Vulnerability Surge, European Parliament Bans AI
item.description: Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Axonius lays off employees, Abu Dhabi conference data leak, HackerOne addresses AI concerns. The post In Other News: Ransomware Shuts US Clinics, ICS V...

item.title: Why the shift left dream has become a nightmare for security and developers
item.description: The "shift left" approach has increased pressure on developers, as speed demands override security checks in modern CI pipelines. Qualys explains how analyzing 34,000 public container images revealed 7.3% were malicio...

item.title: Cline CLI 2.3.0 Supply Chain Attack Installed OpenClaw on Developer Systems
item.description: In yet another software supply chain attack, the open-source, artificial intelligence (AI)-powered coding assistant Cline CLI was updated to stealthily install OpenClaw, a self-hosted autonomous AI agent that has beco...

item.title: Code Mode: give agents an entire API in 1,000 tokens
item.description: The Cloudflare API has over 2,500 endpoints. Exposing each one as an MCP tool would consume over 2 million tokens. With Code Mode, we collapsed all of it into two tools and roughly 1,000 tokens of context.

item.title: Latin America's Cyber Maturity Lags Threat Landscape
item.description: The slower pace of upgrades has the unintended impact of creating a haven for attackers, especially for initial access brokers and ransomware gangs.

item.title: LLMs change their answers based on who’s asking
item.description: AI chatbots may deliver unequal answers depending on who is asking the question. A new study from the MIT Center for Constructive Communication finds that LLMs provide less accurate information, increase refusal rates...

item.title: Criminals create business website to sell RAT disguised as RMM tool
item.description: A RAT masquerading as legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software is being sold to cybercriminals as a service, Proofpoint researchers recently discovered. The fake RMM tool, called TrustConnect, was be...

item.title: PayPal discloses data breach that exposed user info for 6 months
item.description: PayPal is notifying customers of a data breach after a software error in a loan application exposed their sensitive personal information, including Social Security numbers, for nearly 6 months last year. [...]

item.title: North Korean IT worker scam nets Ukrainian five-year sentence in the U.S.
